name: Finance
description: Manage our budget, secure funding through grants and sponsorships, and ensure financial sustainability.
responsibilities: Grant writing and fundraising campaigns
Budget tracking and financial reporting
Revenue stream development

teams.name: Development
teams.description: Secure sustainable funding and drive revenue growth
responsibilities: Identify and pursue grant opportunities to secure sustainable funding
Plan and execute fundraising campaigns and events to support chapter operations
Develop creative revenue streams to strengthen BinaryHeart's financial sustainability

teams.name: Compliance
teams.description: Ensure financial transparency and accurate reporting
responsibilities: Track financial activity including income, expenses, receipts, reimbursements, and inventory valuation
Develop and maintain chapter budget tracking procedures for transparency and accountability
Ensure timely, accurate monthly reports and provide clean data

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Financial analysis, grant writing, budget management, Excel/Google Sheets proficiency, professional communication, fundraising strategy, and nonprofit finance operations.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Students interested in business, accounting, nonprofit management, or anyone looking to develop strong analytical and organizational skills.

name: Marketing
description: Spread the word about our mission through media production, communications, and strategic partnerships.
responsibilities: Photo and video content production
Public-facing documents and marketing materials
Partner and sponsor relationship management

teams.name: Media
teams.description: Produce high-quality visual content and storytelling
responsibilities: Produce high-quality photo and video content at events
Film and produce tech literacy programming and high-impact commercial advertising
Create public-facing content for social impact causes

teams.name: Communications
teams.description: Represent BinaryHeart and create compelling marketing materials
responsibilities: Represent BinaryHeart at partner events and be the face of the organization
Oversee public-facing documents including yearly impact reports, newsletters, and donor pitch decks
Create marketing materials such as flyers and graphics, and write content for BinaryHeart on digital platforms like LinkedIn

teams.name: External Relations
responsibilities: Manage and maintain all organizational partners, including sponsors, affiliates, and partners
Gain experience in client relationship management, and outreach
Acquire event partnerships, contacts, and build a professional network

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Social media marketing, graphic design, content creation, brand management, public relations, and digital communications. You'll learn industry-standard tools and build a portfolio of real work.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Creative students interested in marketing, communications, journalism, or design. Perfect for anyone who loves storytelling and connecting with audiences.

name: Operations
description: Work hands-on with computers—source devices, refurbish and repair, and distribute to those in need.
responsibilities: Device sourcing and donation drives
Computer refurbishment and repair
Distribution and recipient support
Open to all—no application needed!

teams.name: Sourcing
teams.description: Secure device donations and organize collection efforts
responsibilities: Secure device donations from individuals, schools, and corporate partners
Organize and run donation drives and pickups
Ensure the refurbishment team has a steady flow of incoming devices

teams.name: Refurbishment
teams.description: Repair, upgrade, and prepare computers for distribution
responsibilities: Wipe devices securely and repair/upgrade hardware
Install standard software for reliable, ready-to-use computers
Train and coordinate volunteers to follow consistent repair workflows

teams.name: Distribution
responsibilities: Manage applications and vet recipients (individuals & organizations)
Allocate devices fairly and deliver with proper setup/training resources
Collect feedback and track impact from device recipients

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Hardware troubleshooting, software installation, inventory management, quality control, and technical documentation. You'll develop practical IT skills that are directly applicable to careers in technology support, systems administration, and computer repair.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Hands-on learners, tech enthusiasts, and anyone wanting practical experience with computer hardware and software. No prior experience required—just curiosity and a willingness to learn! Perfect for students interested in IT, computer science, or anyone who wants to make a tangible impact in their community.

name: Membership
description: Build and sustain a strong, inclusive volunteer community where every member feels valued, connected, and engaged in BinaryHeart's mission.
responsibilities: Community engagement and chapter-wide events
Professional development and skills workshops
Creative workshops and hands-on activities
Open to all—no application needed!

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Event management, community building, policy administration, leadership development, and organizational communication. You'll learn how to cultivate an inclusive chapter culture while ensuring operational excellence and regulatory compliance.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: People-oriented students, aspiring leaders, and anyone interested in organizational development and community engagement. Perfect for those who want to shape chapter culture, build meaningful connections, and ensure Binary Heart at IU remains a welcoming, effective, and compliant organization.
